attributes.action: Create Environmental Impact ratings for businesses with associated fines/reliefs
attributes.background: Implement a simple 5-point rating system similar to hygiene rating, but for all UK businesses and public bodies on their environmental impact, covering all aspects of business supply chain and product life. There would be fines for low performers and financial relief for high performers.
attributes.additional_details:
Implement a 5-point rating system for all businesses in the UK for Environmental Impact. Scoring 1 to 5 similar to hygiene rating. Example would be:
1: High Impact
2: Moderate Impact
3: Mild Impact
4: Minimal or Negligible
5: Beneficial to environment
This would cover suppliers, product life, end of life, transport, energy supply, waste management, impact on environment, dealing with detrimental suppliers. Low scoring businesses will incur fines, and high scoring businesses financial relief.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Place a 80% Import duty on Chinese goods
attributes.background: Place a 80% Import Duty on Chinese goods to Boycott China, we are too dependent as a nation on Imports and the service industry makes us a weak country. This could be done more slowly starting at 40% whilst Manufacturing is made priority.
attributes.additional_details: We are too dependent on others to make our goods, goods are made cheaply and are made not to last which also damages the environment; with our throw it away culture.

departments.name: Department for International Trade

attributes.action: Make mental health and wellbeing checks compulsory in all levels of education
attributes.background: Mental health teams should be doing reviews on 18s and under in schools to look for underlying mental health conditions before they become too problematic for the person affected or those around them.Two check ups during primary school,two check ups in secondary,one in college and one in university.
attributes.additional_details: This can help with: Noticing physiological child abuse,unhealthy home environments and bullying.It also helps with noticing the start of conditions before they get sevear impacting quality of life.It would give 18s and under the tools to correctly manage negative emotions which would help in reducing teen suicide and self harm rates and teen violence.It would aid in breaking stereotypes on mental health while helping young people access help.Early intervention could saves lives in so many ways.

departments.name: Department for Education

attributes.action: All drivers to take a refresher course every 10 years.
attributes.background: Create a law that states every driver on the road must sit a competency test, (practical and theory) every 10 years. With a Green, Amber, Red scoring system. Green - Pass. Amber - Pass but must have some retraining. Fail - Must retrain and retest, can no longer drive on their current license.
attributes.additional_details: The roads are changing, the laws are changing yet no one is retrained to drive on our roads. Dangerous drivers will be removed from the roads making our roads much safer and CO2 emissions could be hugely reduced with less vehicles on the road. Safer roads means less incidents caused, which in turn creates a safer environment for everyone. The rates of car insurance could be significantly reduced as the risk of collision/injury will be cut.

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for cyclists to use cycle paths where available
attributes.background: Make it a legal requirement for cyclists to use cycle paths where they exist.
attributes.additional_details:
The increasing popularity of cycling is impacting road safety and the capacity of the road network.

Often this occurs in spite of purpose built cycle paths being available providing a safe environment for those cycling and clearing potential congestion from the roads

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Ban the sale and use of Rodenticides
attributes.background: I would like the Government to ban the sale and use of rodenticides. There is evidence of secondary poisoning of other species from the consumption of the target species that has ingested the rodenticide.
attributes.additional_details: Rodenticides are causing the deaths of other species of birds and mammals, caused by the consumption of prey which has ingested a rodenticide. Toxins from the chemical brodifacoum for example build up causing a slow, suffering death. The use of rodenticides is not target specific enough and can cause wider lethal implications to other animals in the environment. We believe the sale and use of these products should be banned.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Fund minimum of 10 support centres across England for homeless youth
attributes.background: The Government should fund a minimum of 10 homeless centres across England, aimed, specifically, at vulnerable homeless youth. This funding should support these centres to supply young people with a safe environment and basic necessities, including free sanitary products for women.
attributes.additional_details: Statistics from Centrepoint estimate that nearly 122,000 young people across the UK asked for support from their local council because they were homeless or in danger of losing a home in 2020/21. The pandemic, combined with the increase in the cost of living, has exacerbated social and economic causes, particularly, for young people. We must provide targeted support to help break the cycle of homelessness and the provision of more secure accommodation is essential to achieving this.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Require public-facing workers to use clear or windowed face coverings
attributes.background: Push for the use of windowed or clear face masks on public transport, in pubs, restaurants, hospitals, pharmacies, etc so that deaf people can lip read and are not excluded
attributes.additional_details:
Face masks have been made mandatory in a lot of places, pushing deaf and hard of hearing people out of these environments.
 
I am starting a petition as this issue is overlooked when in this day and age there is no excuse for a lack of accessibility.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

attributes.action: Fund fruit trees for public parks and green spaces
attributes.background: The Government should fund schemes to plant edible fruit trees in public green spaces and parks. This would help those who are struggling for food to eat something even if it is just a piece of fruit.
attributes.additional_details: Following the cost of living crisis, it makes logical sense to help tackle this with the introduction of fruit trees in parks such as apple trees. Not only is this good for the environment but will also help tackle the shortage of food and provide the public with a form of natural food.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Do not give consent to the Rampion2 windfarm extension off the coast of Sussex
attributes.background: Energy companies should be encouraged to invest in windfarms out of sight of land such as the North Sea, enabling connection with the existing offshore grid network and keeping the impact to a minimum. Here stronger and more consistent winds should result in higher efficiencies than in the Channel.
attributes.additional_details: We believe the proposal to install up to 116 wind turbines in Sussex Bay stretching from Worthing to Selsey will blight the entire horizon along this area of outstanding natural beauty. The turbines will be as tall as 325m, 2.35 times the height of Rampion1 turbines, and higher than any hill in West Sussex. Sited only 8 miles from the shoreline, this proposal will be much nearer land than most offshore windfarms and will impact hard on local communities, the environment and the economy.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Remove Vehicle Excise Duty and add the cost to Fuel Duty
attributes.background: Abolish Vehicle Excise Duty and add the cost to a litre of fuel, so the more economical the vehicle you drive - the less you pay. This should encourage people to drive more responsibly and also benefit the environment.
attributes.additional_details: To encourage people to drive less polluting vehicles and also making the people that use the roads most pay more for their upkeep.

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: Send aid to Mauritius to help clear the oil spill.
attributes.background: The UK has experienced oil spills in the past and know the catastrophic effects that it can cause to the biodiversity of native wildlife. Resources within Mauritius to clear an oil spill of this size are limited and, therefore, aiding the country to clear the spill is essential.
attributes.additional_details: From our history of oil spills, such as the Torrey Canyon disaster in 1967 spilling 119,000 tonnes of crude oil, we are able to provide expertise, equipment and solutions to the communities who are working to contain and clear the oil spill. This is needed to be done sooner rather than later due to the disastrous effects it can cause on the environment as well as the country’s economy that strongly relies on tourism, due to its pristine coasts.

departments.name: Foreign, Commonwealth & Development Office

attributes.action: Ban the sale and use of sky lanterns
attributes.background: Ban them as they are dangerous as they cause fires and can easily harm livestock.
attributes.additional_details: They not only set fire to buildings but can land on livestock. I've heard stories of them landing on horses, setting fire to their rugs (which they can not get out of), and burning them. These are dangerous to the environment.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Ban drilling for fossil fuels and put more money into using renewable energy.
attributes.background: We see destruction to the environment every day that passes. I believe by banning the drilling on fossil fuels, we can make a difference to what is happening to the Earth right now, alternatively we should use renewable energy and have the government use the technology we have right now.
attributes.additional_details: The banning of drilling for fossil fuels will push more to our goals for the climate, In a few months COP26 will be held in Scotland to discuss the climate crisis; by then it may be more frequent in use meaning more research to improve renewable energy. Thirdly, I believe by doing this other world leaders will follow by example by doing the right thing for the Earth, climate change affects everyone and we need to actually do something longer term rather than short term.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Lower the national speed limit for country lanes to 40mph
attributes.background: Protect animals from being killed by drivers by making the speed limit 40mph on country lanes. This means the driver needs a shorter amount of space needed to brake in order to stop the vehicle in time for the animal to move.
attributes.additional_details: Seeing deceased animals in such a horrific state on the road can ruine someone’s day. Animals also have families and feelings which people do not understand. The world's animals are slowly but surely becoming endangered or even extinct. Animals help our environment in rural areas. Linking to the animal Welfare act 2006, the need to be protected from pain suffering disease and injury, animals being killed on the road is going against this.

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Make the teaching of neurodiversity mandatory in schools
attributes.background: Please make it mandatory that students learn about neurodiversity in school, to help children develop a better understanding and relationships of their peers within schools so that children with additional needs can remain more settled in mainstream.
attributes.additional_details: Autistic children can become unsettled in the school environment, particularly if they are bullied by their peers through their lack of knowledge and understanding. This places stress on parents and the school also. I am an early years practitioner of 17 years and I am passionate about special educational needs. We instil diverse values from a young age so why not carry this throughout the entire school years but in more depth knowledge and understanding is key.

departments.name: Department for Education

attributes.action: Introduce heavy fixed penalties starting at £1000 minimum for littering
attributes.background: The only way to tackle the litter problem is with very heavy fines backed up by a hard hitting TV campaign and mandatory environmental education in schools. The income from the fines could be used to deploy more enforcement officers and create a dedicated reporting website for video evidence.
attributes.additional_details: There is a growing element of the population who have no respect for the environment, the law, other people or clearly, themselves. UK courts can issue fines of up to £2500 for littering but is this ever done? Fixed penalties of £50-£80 clearly are no deterrent. In Singapore the fine for a first littering offence is S$2000. Second offence S$4000. All subsequent offences S$10,000. Plus a CWO (community work order).

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Bring high percentage ethanol fuel to the UK
attributes.background: Follow the lead of European countries including Finland, France and Sweden, also America, Brazil and Australia, incentivise renewable ethanol biofuel to be made available at the fuel pump for the masses.
attributes.additional_details: Ethanol in fuels produce less carbon monoxide due to its more complete combustion and higher oxygen content. Incomplete combustion also creates hydrocarbons. Ethanol also produces less nitrogen oxide emissions which have a huge impact on the environment and humans. Ethanol creates less fine particulate matter which caused an estimated 200,000 premature deaths in 2014. Most engines can convert ethanols energy better and run better. While fuel consumption does go up energy efficiency also goes up.

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: Require companies to display environmental rating of the products on packaging
attributes.background:
Make it a legal requirement for companies to display environmental impact information of a product on the products packaging in the same way as nutrition information is shown.

The information should include; CO2 emissions and energy used when making the product and proportion of recycled content.
attributes.additional_details:
The nutrition traffic light information provides a consistent measure for consumers allowing them to compare one product to another.
 
The intention is that a similar approach can be used for environmental impact information helping consumers make an informed decision as to which is better for the environment and therefore which to buy.
 
This in turn will drive competition between producers in this area incentivising them to look for ways to improve the products environmental credentials.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Ban the use of non recyclable plastics in food/drink packaging
attributes.background:
I would like to ban the use of non recyclable plastics in food/drink packaging. These plastics can take hundreds of years to biodegrade.

 By using recyclable plastics. we can take another step to eradicate single use plastics altogether.
attributes.additional_details:
Plastic is widely known to be harmful to the environment.
It can take thousands of years to biodegrade. Pollute our oceans harming marine life.
By helping to eradicate single use plastic today. You can help make a better tomorrow

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Require UK-based manufacturers to run on a closed-loop water cycle
attributes.background: UK based manufacturers must be made to run on closed-loop water cycles, that make them fully responsible for their water usage, impact on the environment, and removal of hazardous waste contaminants, and immensely reduce the UK’s fresh water requirements, from its ever depleting resources.
attributes.additional_details: In a WRAP study from 2011, the UK's manufacturing sector used over 550,000ML (megaliters/1,000,000L) of fresh water in 2006. Companies must be made liable for the proper filtering and reuse of all its non-consumptive water in order to hugely reduce their impact on the environment. Examples such as L'Oreal's closed-loop water cycle in their Spain, Italy and Russian plants, prove the UK can begin to minimize its carbon footprint and the damage inflicted upon its resources.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Change our time zone to Single/Double British Summertime (SDST)
attributes.background: Around 1 in 3 people suffer from Seasonal Affective Disorder in the UK; moving on to SDST could greatly combat this. Rather than wasting the precious hour of light in the morning, on a commute or in an office, we could utilise it in the evening, after work, for socialising and outdoor activities.
attributes.additional_details:
The key benefits:

Health: SAD could be reduced as people could use the longer evenings to socialise and engage in leisure activities such as sport.

Safety: It could prevent 80 deaths and more than 200 serious injuries on UK roads every year.

Environment: CO2 pollution could be reduced by at least 447,000 tonnes each year, due to a lower electricity demand for artificial light in the evenings.

Tourism: UK tourism industry could be boosted by £1bn every year due to longer and lighter days.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Make ‘can be recycled’ labelling clearer on all products
attributes.background: The government should require manufacturers to introduce red /green stickers on their products – red if it can’t be recycled, green if it can, and amber if mixed plastic, to make it clearer for consumers.
attributes.additional_details: This would help towards saving the environment. Not everyone recycles, sometimes people can be confused around the packaging on items as some plastics are non-recyclable - making this unclear for some who want to make a contribution to the recycling programme.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Immediately provide funding and guidance to local councils to improve recycling
attributes.background: Alongside the Environment Act 2021, the Government pledged to provide funding and guidance to local councils to improve recycling. This has not materialised. We want the Government to provide the promised guidance and funding immediately.
attributes.additional_details:
The climate crisis cannot be tackled while recyclable waste keeps going to landfill.
 
Without this funding and guidance, local councils will struggle to move ahead and many will simply maintain inadequate recycling systems. Without this funding, too many local councils are unwilling to invest in recycling services for fear of losing money. Without this funding, too many councils cannot afford to make necessary improvements.
 
Guidance and funding are vital for tackling waste in the context of the climate emergency. We need urgent Government action on all aspects of the environment, and this is one key step towards that.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Require environmental impact information on food packaging
attributes.background: Changing your diet can also reduce your carbon footprint. Providing more information about the environmental impact of the food we eat could change consumption habits and would incentivise innovation in food production.
attributes.additional_details: Food items have a climate footprint, like anything else. With growing fears of what our impact on the environment is, I feel that the consumer needs more information on how their purchasing habits affect the world around them in addition to how it will affect their health. Adding climate footprint labelling (like a ‘climate impact’ traffic light model), in addition to the current nutritional information, will go some way to doing so.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Run Eat Responsibly campaign and require labels on meat, egg and dairy products
attributes.background: I am asking for an 'Eat Responsibly' campaign to be launched about consumption of meat, eggs and dairy products, similar to public awareness campaigns about responsible drinking. In addition, products containing meat, dairy and eggs should be required to display an 'Eat Responsibly' label.
attributes.additional_details: The animal agriculture industry is responsible for being one of the leading causes driving climate change and rising global temperatures. Scientific evidence shows the negative effects on the environment as well as public health that the meat and dairy industries and products have, whether that be in the form of zoonotic diseases, or the direct negative impact a heavily meat and dairy-based diet can have on an individual’s health, which in turn puts more strain on public health systems.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Lift ban on self-employment for international students on a Student visa
attributes.background: Please lift self-employment restrictions for Student visa holders. Considering the benefit of international students to higher education institutions’ finances, the UK should offer equal opportunities to all its students to foster an environment where overseas students get fair chances to thrive.
attributes.additional_details: International students are 27.5% of the student population, pay higher tuition fees, and contribute £25.9 billion to the economy. Yet, Student visa holders aren’t allowed to be self-employed, limiting the student diversity in the UK being properly reflected in the young adult freelancer population and opening doors for employers to take advantage. As freelancing rises in popularity to build an early career, international students should be able to participate in the independent worker economy.

departments.name: Department for Education

attributes.action: Start an All-Party Beveridge-Style ‘Futures’ Report
attributes.background:
In 1942, with Britain at a low ebb, and no-one sure of the war's outcome, the National Government set up the Beveridge Report.

The Government should work with the House of Commons to immediately agree to support, constitute & resource a new Beveridge-style 'Futures' report, starting straightaway.
attributes.additional_details:
We must think and act with foresight over what we want the UK to be like ‘after’.

Beveridge asked what we'd learnt from the 20s/30s. What do we want now? How do we act now to prepare? 

Much could be better, after, when the pandemic ends: politics, the economy, social issues, environment, health, etc. However, first reactions may just be relief, gratitude and a 'return to normality’/‘business as usual’.

We need to think bigger and better, now, in preparation for the medium-/long-term future.

departments.name: Cabinet Office

attributes.action: Ban the production, sale and use of disposal BBQs
attributes.background: The government should ban the production, sale and use of disposable barbeques to prevent gorse fires which happen regularly throughout the spring and summer. Huge destruction is caused to nature and wildlife, and the fire services are stretched, putting lives in danger.
attributes.additional_details: With gorse fires a regular occurance, likely from the carelessness caused by members of the public, the risk to nature and the environment is irreplaceable. Disposal barbecues should be banned to prevent gorse fires from happening and destroying vast AONB like the Mourne Mountains. This is one example of destruction caused by a gorse fire. This has caused irreplaceable damage to the environment and puts the lives of people at risk due to the resources needed to manage these fires.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Renationalise the railways
attributes.background: Put the railway lines & trains under government control, and make rail a priority transport infrastructure and public service.
attributes.additional_details: Privatization of rail cost the country far more in 'investment' and subsidies than running it publically; they were far more punctual & the lines were better served. Trains are also far more efficient in terms of speed and # of people they can carry & far better for the local & global environment. Large public services, like the railways ought to be, require large, coordinated (i.e. government) direction to succeed.

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Modify arrangements for Home Education of children with an EHCP
attributes.background: Recognise that inclusion isn't always the answer. Parents should have the right to home educate their children. Some children who are autistic, have ADD, ADHD or sensory processing issues need an environment free from the bombardment of stimuli to thrive. They need provision for education at home.
attributes.additional_details:
Our son is 13. He is highly intelligent and sociable yet sensitive to colour, pattern, light, sound and textures. Environments are exhausting to him. We cannot desensitise our son. He was born this way. He shouldn’t have to fit the world of education we have created. We should be creating a world of education that fits him.
 
At present a local authority can require a child with an EHCP to attend a particular school, and parents can also lose support provided through an EHCP if they opt to home educate their child.

By providing help and funding for EHE children with EHCP's, money could be saved on appeals, mental health and CAMHS referrals, invested instead in our children's futures.

departments.name: Department for Education

attributes.action: The UK should ban the importation of Shark Fins for personal consumption
attributes.background:
After Brexit, ban the carriage of shark fins in to the UK for personal use
EU law allows individuals travelling to Europe to carry 20kg of dried shark fins for personal consumption. THIS SHOULD STOP
attributes.additional_details:
More action is needed after the government response to this petition:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300535

To quote the Dept for Environment, Food & Rural Affairs:

"EU law allows individuals travelling to Europe to carry 20kg of dried shark fins for personal consumption. Our departure from the EU allows us to consider options to tighten the personal import allowance and improve the traceability of the shark in fin trade in the UK."

departments.name: Department for International Trade

attributes.action: Ban smoking cigarettes on apartment balconies.
attributes.background: Ban smoking cigarettes on apartment balconies to prevent neighbouring residents who smoke from blowing smoke into non-smokers' apartments. Provide non-smokers with a smoke-free environment in their home.
attributes.additional_details: The secondhand smoke from neighbouring apartments with residents who smoke is blown into the apartments of non-smokers. The health risks of breathing secondhand smoke is well documented and governments in other countries have taken action to ban smoking on apartment balconies due to the health risks presented to non-smoking neighbours. The UK Government should ban smoking on apartment balconies as it currently presents an uncontrollable health risk to non-smokers in their homes.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

attributes.action: Create a law that requires unnecessary lighting to be turned off
attributes.background: Create a law that requires lights in shop window displays to be turned off at 1am. Interior lights in offices and other non-residential buildings should be switched off an hour after the last employee leaves.
attributes.additional_details: The impact will be to save wasted energy and reduce the impact of light pollution in the country, all of which damages wildlife, humans and the environment.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Require labels on all products showing water and carbon usage in manufacture
attributes.background: Just as we have nutritional information, alcohol volume and energy consumption ratings on product - we ask that manufacturers add a label to indicate how much water and carbon went into the manufacture of a product in the form of a clear and easy to understand rating for consumers.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Reforest England - Use unproductive rural areas and expand existing woodland.
attributes.background:
‘Reforest’ initiative to significantly increase woodland and forest areas making use of unproductive or uneconomical farmland. 
Use CPO powers to acquire land for public use.
Woodland Trust and Forestry Commission to identify areas, guide acquisitions and subsequently manage environment.
attributes.additional_details:
Woodland and forest covers approximately 10% of England. We need to restore our forests and natural habitats significantly by securing, planting and protecting new woodland areas. 
Encourage greater access and understanding by the general public. 
Farmland in less productive areas is cheap and easy to acquire. 
Farmers are the logical custodians of the such areas supporting established trust organisations. 
Objective to increase the extent and diversity of our woodland by 100% every 5 years.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Ban the sale of non-biodegradable dog poo bags
attributes.background: Limit the sale of dog poo bags to those which biodegrade, in order to protect the environment.
attributes.additional_details: There are 8.9 million dogs in the UK. Many of the UK's dog owners use disposable, non-biodegradable dog poo bags on a regular basis. This use of plastic poses a grave risk to the environment, especially when not correctly disposed of. Biodegradable bags are readily available

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Ban plastic for being used to attach tags/labels to clothes.
attributes.background: Make sure recyclable/reusable alternatives are used to attach clothes labels/tags and ban plastic as a means to attach.
attributes.additional_details: Plastic shouldn't be used in clothes because well the small amount to attach the label is just cut away, then thrown away, it's such a waste and potentially harmful to the environment.

attributes.action: Consider estate agents for the vaccine before being rolled out to all
attributes.background: Let estate agents work to their full capacity by allowing them to have the vaccine before it is rolled out to all. Our working environment means we are going in and out of households and our clients and agents would feel safer if we were vaccinated.
attributes.additional_details: So that we are safer in our working environment of mixing with households. I think all estate agents know they are not key workers but are considered essential. We are not asking to be put above anyone vulnerable or key workers but to be considered before the mass roll out to all

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

attributes.action: Fund free boarding school places for young people unable to live at home
attributes.background: Provide state funding for places at boarding schools, including education and accommodation, for children aged 16+ who are unable to live at home. This may include LGBT or secular children rejected by their families, or children from dysfunctional homes.
attributes.additional_details:
I am a trans-woman who grew up in a religious environment and never had the choice as a child to leave home and live the life I needed to live. I have suffered terribly ever since and, only recently, decades later, have I begun the slow process of transition.
I do not want others to suffer as I have, have their lives robbed from them or face homelessness.
Fully funded places at boarding schools would make it easier for children aged 16+ to choose to leave obstructive homes and live the life of their choice.

departments.name: Department for Education

attributes.action: Impose a corporation tax surcharge on companies that produce single-use plastics
attributes.background: Impose a corporation tax surcharge on companies that produce single-use plastics, based on the cost of removing plastic waste from the environment. The worst offenders would pay the highest surcharges, which would act as an incentive to change their behaviour.
attributes.additional_details: Every year billions of single-use plastic bottles and plastic packaging are bought across the UK, most ending up in landfill sites and in the oceans, causing damage to wildlife and resulting in microplastics that pollute the food chain. It can take upwards of 450 years for a single plastic bottle to degrade and so the problem is one that is going to affect future generations. It’s about time the Government took this problem seriously and showed they are serious about sustainability.

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: Introduce new requirements for pets, owners and breeders
attributes.background: The Government should introduce new legal requirements for licences and training for all pet owners and breeders, and microchipping for all pets. This would help ensure the safety of people and animals, and create new job opportunities in the animal welfare sector.
attributes.additional_details:
Anyone who owns or breeds pets of any kind should be required to get a licence, with mandatory pet care classes, and breeding classes for breeders, to provide owners/breeders with the knowledge to care for their pet & act appropriately in all situations as well as ensuring the well-being of the animals.
 
To ensure the safety of people (especially infants) and also ensure the safety, health & welfare of the animals & the environment too.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Ban plastic bags illegal and require the use of biodegradable bags instead
attributes.background:
We must pay 5p per general-sized bag. From 1 April this goes up to 10p per bag. Our modern lifestyle means many people are 'impromptu shoppers', and usually have no issue spending 5p. 
Italy introduced biodegradable 'plastic' bags in 2011 and charge less than 5p per bag. Plastic pollutes our planet
attributes.additional_details:
Biodegradable 'plastic' bags have been in use in Italy since 2011 with great success, they don't pollute the environment, which I think as a responsible citizen of this planet we should all be striving to improve on.

I hope that you will all give this serious consideration.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Ban cyclists from using a handheld mobile phone while cycling
attributes.background: Enforce rules for cyclists, similar to the ones for motorists. If being in a car and using your mobile phone is punishable for motorists it makes no difference for cyclists as they're putting their in own life at risk. Distraction doesn't ask what vehicle you're using.
attributes.additional_details: As a delivery driver I see everyday cases of road abuses. While laws become tougher on motorists, cyclists are left without proper supervision for their actions, putting their own lives at risk and potentially risking someone innocent being charged because if their inconsiderate actions. If a driver will be penalised for using mobile phone what is the difference for cyclists? Obstructing your perception of environment using earplugs is another example. Sign for tougher policing on cyclists.

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Ban all plastic packaging
attributes.background:
There are alternatives to plastics to package goods.
 
Plastics are often disposed of irresponsibly, so that even if they can be recycled they end up in the ecosystem.
 
There is well documented mass long term environmental damage.
attributes.additional_details:
Packaging should meet the following principles:
 
- Does not harm the environment if disposed irresponsibly.
- Does not harm the environment dis-proportionally to other packaging materials when manufactured.
- Can be reused or recycled.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Fund increase in recycling bins in all city and town centres
attributes.background: The Government should fund local authorities to install more recycling bins in every town and city centre, and require them to monitor their use.
attributes.additional_details: If there are more recycling bins and people recycle more, then fewer new plastic bottles and other plastics need to be made, so this will be better for the environment.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Set a legal maximum temperature for all indoor workplaces
attributes.background: The Health and Safety Executive suggests the minimum temperature in a workplace should normally be at least 16 degrees Celsius, but there is no equivalent maximum in law or guidance. Many workplaces are so hot they cause adverse consequences to employees, including passing out.
attributes.additional_details: The Government should set a maximum temperature for all indoor workplaces in law. For working environments such as offices this could be around 30 degrees Celsius, and for environments involving strenuous labour it should be lower, at around 26 degrees Celsius.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Ban the sale of plastic toys with children’s magazines
attributes.background: To stop selling plastic toys with children’s magazines.
attributes.additional_details: Because it’s unnecessary and bad for the environment. A majority of these toys are poorly made and are quickly thrown out. They hold children’s attention for a short amount of time, do not last long and are hardly ever educational.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Ban the sale of gift wrap that is non-recyclable.
attributes.background: Please ban gift wrap that contains elements that are no recyclable, I.e glitter, foil and plastic.
attributes.additional_details:
We need to take steps to protect harmful products from ending up as landfill and from chemicals used in these products effecting the environment. 

Banning these types of non-recyclable gift wraps is a small and important step.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Create a ‘Day of Rest’ in each calendar week as we come out lockdown.
attributes.background: The lockdown has proved that we as a nation can not only survive but also thrive when we’re forced to Slow down and bring about a natural pause or stop in our busy lives. The environment and wild animal species have been allowed in many respects to return to ‘their normal’ as pollution levels drop.
attributes.additional_details:
To return to having a day of rest where planes, trains and transport systems were halted for 24hrs, where businesses and schools  re charged through ‘stopping’ and allowed employees and pupils to rejuvenate or work from home.
Carbon emissions targets would surely be more obtainable.
This doesn’t have to be based on the old model of a religious day of rest, but of course those who wish to return to still contemplation and prayer could do so. It would be more powerful as an international movement.
